text:
Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport is a major airport in the U.S. state of Alaska. It is located southwest of downtown Anchorage. The airport is named for Ted Stevens, a U.S. senator from Alaska in office from 1968 to 2009.
It is included in the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems for 2017–2021, in which it is categorized as a medium-hub primary commercial service facility.

annotations.surface_form: National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems
